content.question: Two cubes, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, are pushed at a constant velocity along a rough surface. The coefficient of kinetic friction between each cube and the surface is the same. Cube <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has three times the surface area and twice the mass of Cube <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>. What is the ratio of the force <math alttext="F sub lowercase f A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></msub></math> of kinetic friction exerted on Cube <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to the force <math alttext="F sub lowercase f B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub></math> of kinetic friction exerted on Cube <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
